title: How to use Keywords Everywhere to find low competition keywords

tactics.name: forum-based keyword research
tactics.description: identify low competition keywords by analyzing user-generated content platforms like forums, quora, and reddit
steps: search for keywords in google and analyze search results
prioritize keywords with 20-100 monthly search volume
locate forums and user content on first page results
use related searches and google auto-suggestions for additional terms
caveats: zero search volume keywords may still attract traffic through long-tail queries
source_quotes: forums are not specifically optimized for seo so if they rank on first page they're likely low competition

heuristics.name: low-volume keyword prioritization
heuristics.condition: if search volume is between 20-100, prioritize for low competition
source_quotes: i like to be between 20 and 30 or around 100

claims.statement: keywords everywhere is the only paid tool used for keyword research
source_quotes: keywords everywhere is the only paid tool that i use

niche_patterns.description: combine specific niches with targeted solutions to identify underserved markets
niche_patterns.why_it_works: targets specific audience needs with minimal competition
source_quotes: how to build a soccer conditioning base this might be good
